metadata.dc:author: Allende Riera, A J
de Sequera Rahola, M
Martínez Gimeno, E
Cárdenas Negro, C
metadata.dc:description: A 34-year-old man with Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome (KTS) was performed three bone scintigraphies. The first one to evaluate the possibility of avascular necrosis of the femoral head. Secondly, to dismiss a reflex sympathetic dystrophy in the affected lower limb and finally, due to knee pain. Magnetic resonance of pelvis and knee and biopsy of iliac spine were performed too.
metadata.dc:title: Síndrome de Klippel-Trenaunay y gammagrafía ósea. A propósito de un caso.
[Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome and bone scintigraphy. A case report].
